body:
This PR lets `bitcoind` to call an arbitrary command `-signer=<cmd>`, e.g. a hardware wallet driver,  where it can fetch public keys, ask to display an address, and sign a PSBT.

Depends on:
* #14565: Overhaul `importmulti` logic
* #14491: Allow descriptor imports with `importmulti`
* #14021: Import key origin data through descriptors in importmulti
* #14075: Import watch only pubkeys to the keypool if private keys are disabled
* A big rebase; all the above are in @achow101's [hww branch](https://github.com/achow101/bitcoin/tree/hww), which this builds on top of ([this PR](https://github.com/achow101/bitcoin/pull/2) directly on top of the `hww` branch is more readable). 

It's design to work @achow101's Python HWI project, which supports multiple hardware wallets. Any command with the same arguments and return values will work. It simplifies the manual procedure described [here](https://github.com/achow101/HWI/blob/master/docs/bitcoin-core-usage.md). (For now, you need a slight variant of his script: 
https://github.com/achow101/HWI/pull/73).

Usage is documented in [doc/external-signer.md](
https://github.com/Sjors/bitcoin/blob/2018/11/rpc-signer/doc/external-signer.md), which also describes what protocol a different signer binary should conform to.

It adds the following RPC methods:
* `enumeratesigners`: asks <cmd> for a list of signers (e.g. devices) and their master key fingerprint
* `signerfetchkeys`: asks <cmd> for BIP44/49/84 (todo: make configurable) descriptors and then fills the keypool (no private keys)
* `signerdisplayaddress <address>`:  asks <cmd> to display an address

It modifies `walletprocesspsbt <psbt>` to send the `<psbt>` to `<cmd>` to sign and wait for the result

Usage TL&DR:
* clone HWI repo somewhere and launch `bitcoind -signer=../HWI/hwi.py`
* create wallet without private keys: `bitcoin-cli createwallet hww`
* list hardware devices: `bitcoin-cli enumeratesigners`
* fetch keys from hardware device into the wallet: `bitcoin-cli -rpcwallet=hww signerfetchkeys`
* display address on device, sign transaction: see [doc/external-signer.md](
https://github.com/Sjors/bitcoin/blob/2018/11/rpc-signer/doc/external-signer.md)
title: [WIP] External signer support (e.g. hardware wallet)
